snippet: The night before a storm, Matt Molinari and Eric Schnepf were handing out fliers in Bound Brook, N.J., when officers stopped them to say soliciting without a permit was illegal.
abstract: Efforts of New Jersey teenagers Matt Molinari and Eric Schnepf to earn money by distributing flyers advertising snow-shoveling services erupts into media frenzy after they are told by police that soliciting without permit is illegal; controversy goes viral after being posted to Bound Brook, NJ, Facebook page, bringing various political interpretations and media circus.
lead_paragraph: The night before a storm, Matt Molinari and Eric Schnepf were handing out fliers in Bound Brook, N.J., when officers stopped them to say soliciting without a permit was illegal.

headline.main: 2 Teenagers Were Eager to Shovel Snow. Then the Police Paid a Visit.
headline.print_headline: 2 Teenagers Were Eager to Shovel Snow. Then the Police Paid a Visit.
